body:
æœ€çˆ±çš„è¯—äººï¼Œæœ€çˆ±çš„é›†å­ã€‚æ‘˜ä¸€äº›å–œæ¬¢çš„å¥å­ï¼Œè‡´ç”Ÿå‘½ä¹‹çœŸæŒšçœŸè¯šã€‚

I have had my invitation to this world's festival, and thus my life has been blessed.

æˆ‘æ¥åˆ°è¿™ä¸–ç•ŒèŠ‚æ—¥çš„è¯·æŸ¬ï¼Œæˆ‘çš„ç”Ÿå‘½å—äº†ç¥ç¦ã€‚

Early in the day it was whispered that we should sail in a boat, only thou and I, and never a soul in the world would know of this our pilgrimage to no country and to no end.

åœ¨æ¸…æ™“çš„å¯†è¯­ä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬çº¦å®šäº†åŒå»æ³›èˆŸï¼Œä¸–ç•Œä¸Šæ²¡æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªäººçŸ¥é“æˆ‘ä»¬è¿™æ— ç›®çš„æ— ç»ˆæ­¢çš„é¨æ¸¸ã€‚

In the meanwhile I smile and I sing all alone. In the meanwhile the air is filling with the perfume of promise.

è¿™æ—¶æˆ‘è‡ªæ­Œè‡ªç¬‘ã€‚è¿™æ—¶ç©ºæ°”é‡Œä¹Ÿå……æ»¡ç€åº”è®¸çš„èŠ¬èŠ³ã€‚

The time that my journey takes is long and the way of it long.

I came out on the chariot of the first gleam of light, and pursued my voyage through the [wildernesses](https://www.zhihu.com/search?q=wildernesses&search_source=Entity&hybrid_search_source=Entity&hybrid_search_extra=%7B%22sourceType%22%3A%22answer%22%2C%22sourceId%22%3A77218287%7D) of worlds leaving my track on many a star and planet.

æˆ‘æ—…è¡Œçš„æ—¶é—´å¾ˆé•¿ï¼Œæ—…é€”ä¹Ÿæ˜¯å¾ˆé•¿çš„ã€‚

Give me the strength lightly to bear my joys and sorrows.

Give me the strength to make my love fruitful in service.

Give me the strength never to disown the poor or bend my knees before insolent might.

Give me the strength to raise my mind high above daily trifles.

And give me the strength to surrender my strength to thy will with love.

If the day is done, if birds sing no more, if the wind has flagged tired, then draw the veil of darkness thick upon me, even as thou hast wrapt the earth with the coverlet of sleep and tenderly closed the petals of the drooping lotus at dusk.

From the traveller, whose sack of provisions is empty before the voyage is ended, whose garment is torn and dustladen, whose strength is exhausted, remove shame and poverty, and renew his life like a flower under the cover of thy kindly night.

When grace is lost from life, come with a burst of song.

å½“ç”Ÿå‘½å¤±å»æ©å® ï¼Œè¯·æƒ æˆ‘ä»¥æ¬¢æ­Œã€‚

I know that the day will come when my sight of this earth shall be lost, and life will take its leave in silence, drawing the last curtain over my eyes.

Yet stars will watch at night, and morning rise as before, and hours heave like sea waves casting up pleasures and pains.

When I think of this end of my moments, the barrier of the moments breaks and I see by the light of death thy world with its careless treasures. Rare is its lowliest seat, rare is its meanest of lives.

Things that I longed for in vain and things that I got---let them pass. Let me but truly possess the things that I ever spurned and overlooked.

title: Ways of due diligence before collecting art.
body:
> ### NOTES!
>
> ***1st Note:*** *This mirror is intended to be a quick guide for what collectors can do to quick re-check artistsâ€™ legitimacy, if you are here only for that you can skip and jump right to â€œ**DUE DILIGENCE**â€ section.*
>
> ***2nd note for donation/collecting the mirror:*** *Due to Mirrorâ€™s recent changes, to avoid the inconvenient collecting through Optimism net, I decided to mint my own NFT Editions on ETH mainnet (with Mirror link attached on the NFTâ€™s description).*
>
> ***There are 3 type of NFTs with 1/1 will go through auction on Foundation.*** *You may support me through these links below and feel free to collect which one you like the most!*
>
> * **[BID 1/1 LEGENDARY!](https://foundation.app/@yun/yuniverse/5?ref=0x010d7eAfceC7589832aca1170aEb23d21951D396)** (1 ETH reserve, [bidding rewards here](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1541240896322015232?s=20&t=T8_PYGr8_18D9QVHV0OqLQ))
> * **[COLLECT RARE](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0xf01a875013d790c8f263a02b13222645fa560e68/1)** (0.1 ETH each; 25 Editions for public)
> * **[COLLECT COMMON](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0xf01a875013d790c8f263a02b13222645fa560e68/2)** (0.01 ETH each; 100 Editions for public)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LY6KHPKg9PJ6IC6AaY58U.png?height=1360&width=3000)

## INTRODUCTION

Hello frens!

A small introduction, Iâ€™m an artist that jumped into the NFT space in April 2021. People know me as [yunyuliart](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart) or you may simply call me Yun.

And Iâ€™m not alone! Meet [Caleb](https://twitter.com/EnigmaticUnreal), a very kind and humble fren I met online that does fancy dev-stuff that I donâ€™t understand about and Caleb comes with a big brain play to keep the space safer! We will talk more about it later.

While being an artist, after a few months Iâ€™ve also slowly started collecting 1/1 NFTs on [Foundation](https://foundation.app/@yun), then slowly I keep catching one by one, some fake artists, impersonators and art thefts that attempted or even sold stolen art that was of course, not theirs. It was tiring as some of you may know Iâ€™ve been [tweeting](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1535538966425874434?s=20&t=TReIyV7VUgFcV9woGhCIgA) to expose those thievesâ€™ wallet addresses to alert my friends & followers just simply so they wonâ€™t spend their hard-worked eth on them and keep the 1/1 community safe.

### Mission Objective

I started my journey at Foundation, Iâ€™ve been observing the platform as a user, And this is the place I started collecting 1/1. Iâ€™m familiar with it so I want to tell a little bit of the reason why I made this Mirror and why this section is about Foundation.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bw2XsK9RuxTYora2xTZK8.jpg?height=487&width=1024)

> *For the record in case you are new, Foundation was previously an exclusive curated-platform where creator needs an invitation to be able to mint and sell NFTs. Then after the invited artists got sale/bid they will get a new invitation to onboard other artists. Long story short Foundation announced on May 18, 2022, that Foundation is open to everyone without an invite.*

[https://twitter.com/foundation/status/1526963563285209089/video/1](https://twitter.com/foundation/status/1526963563285209089/video/1)

Previously, some bad actors saw the opportunity to exploit Foundationâ€™s old curation system, an â€œinviteâ€ supposedly a community-curation system except they invite themselves on their alt wallets to sell a stolen art behind a new anonymous name. It was fairly easy for me to track where certain artists coming from, who invited or introduced them to Foundation, etc, all thanks to the invitation system but itâ€™s a whole different story after Foundationâ€™s choice of opening up the platform without any curation at all. Thus we will hardly know where certain artists are coming from, and who do we ask for their legitimacy for being the original artists or not.

Bad actors previously need the extra steps to get invited, then they need sales to generate invitations so then they can keep inviting their own alt wallet to continue their theft journey and keep repeating those efforts if one wallet got caught.

An open platform but still holding the charisma of an exclusive 1/1 platform making it a better choice for art thefts to sell stolen art with limitless possibilities and can easily hop on another wallet if one wallet got caught by me or someone else.

Although I understand Foundationâ€™s vision that they are aiming for decentralization and pushing forward the web3 boundaries. But **it is now us genuine artists & collectors are going to need the extra steps to sell or collect art**. Honestly I donâ€™t want collectors to need the very extra step of checking whether each artist is legit or not, and I donâ€™t want new/veteran collectors to get scared away due to this.

So here we are, **in this mirror I will need help from all of you guys my friends to at least know what to do, to be cautious of suspicious accounts, to spread this information so all of us are safe whether you are veteran collector, new collector, or upcoming collector :)**

Lastly if people feel convenient and safe on the platform, they will keep using it and even recommending it to their friends. By prioritizing community first we will see a bright future to get mass adoption faster.

## DUE DILIGENCE

**What we are focusing on in this mirror is strictly only art theft,** in which we can objectively say the work belongs to someone else and the minter/uploader is not the original artist.

We are not going to dig into traced art, heavy referenced art, or Copyrighted fanart. Those are grey areas that I maybe will make a separate mirror if I have the chance in the future.

> ***DISCLAIMER:*** *This is all sorted from the first thing I do to the last thing I do but all according to my convenience and my style to do Due Diligence AND might not be the perfect way for someone else.*

*So, first step is..*

### 1. Reverse Image Search

This will be the first thing that comes to mind for most people on this stuff. Simply copy-paste or drag & drop the jpeg to a certain website, and it will try to search for the most similar picture according to each website.

Here are some websites you can use from best to bad *according to my experience*:

* **[SauceNao](https://saucenao.com/)** works for anime jpeg, most of the time catches from Pixiv and Twitter
* **[iqdb.org](https://iqdb.org/)** works for anime jpeg, catches from multiple website sources
* **[Yandex](https://yandex.com/)** works for general, sometimes able to catch edited or flipped images
* **[ascii2d](https://ascii2d.net/)** works for anime jpeg
* **[TinEye](https://tineye.com/)** general use
* **[Google](https://www.google.co.id/imghp)** general use

Take a note that a repost will sometimes show up too so you need to check again if the source you got is legit, a quick judge would be from the follower count is low or a seemingly like a shitposting account.

Additional fancy one is [trace.moe](https://trace.moe/) that you can use to search specific anime from a cut anime scene.

*Oh? the website above doesnâ€™t provide any correct source and you still suspicious on the artist?
letâ€™s continue below..*

### 2. Work Portfolio & Art Activity

Another most basic one is to check their background or history on the artistâ€™s whole work portfolio. But I know there are people that rarely or even never posted their artwork/sketches while being legit artist. So this one is not really the answer but more of to add your conviction when an artist is established and already has a lot of works done in their portfolio. Otherwise put more investigation on the next step.

While for art activities, some artists love to post art-related stuff on their social media to keep their audience hyped.

It could be:

* **sketches/WIP**
* **drawing on livestream (example on discord, twitch)**
* **or a speedpaint**

And if you are an emerging artist reading this, I really recommend you to start doing those to gain collectorsâ€™ trust ;)

Note specifically for sketches/WIP, **be wary that sketches is the easiest one to fake.** Could be straight stolen sketch from the original artist again, or a quick traced line art from the original work, or a filter from photoshop/other similar apps. To deal with this unfortunately you need to exercise your eyes to notice the differences.

Yes it sounds tiring as these bad guys will always try to pretend and faking it. *This is why curated platform is good smh..*

> *Here are some of the sketches example from my own work. These are how my progress looks like. Different artist will also use different technique to sketch.*

![Example for one of the filter](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RUjSxHXhwBhJKn168RhEU.jpg?height=1223&width=1800&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&size=medium)

The best option for artists to convince collectors is showing the progress of the work like a video/livestream or a speedpaint if the artist uses procreate. The difference between a video/speedpaint with sketches is that on sketches you will only see a single picture of rough lines look compared to the final result, in the other hand a video/speedpaint will give you many pictures of how the shape progressed, modified, or sometimes changed completely different on some part before the final result.

For example, as Iâ€™m a photoshop user, hereâ€™s my progress from start to final on my recent work.

[https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1540356015983513601](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1540356015983513601)

### 3. On-chain/Web3 Tracking

In this method we will not be relying on the art but instead we check more of the artistâ€™s identity and history across web3 platforms.

I used this method a lot to gather evidences when Iâ€™m exposing art theft in my tweet above if the account is very suspicious.

The steps I usually do are probably looking like this:

* Check the wallet activity on opensea (copy paste the wallet address into `opensea.io/paste-here`). This works for other platforms as well like Foundation (`foundation.app/paste-here`), SuperRare (`superrare.com/paste-here`), etc.
* Some thief tends to use the same wallet to sell/scam other stuff on opensea that is completely unrelated to supposedly their art style (a bit subjective but consider this into your suspicion).
* Check whether their opensea is not flagged/reported.

![Example of removed account due to report](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FOQx70FVUAEX0xb?format=jpg&name=medium)

Or the wallet is flagged or compromised and in the hand of a hacker.

![](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FOQx7b5UYAIsusH?format=jpg&name=small)

* Check the wallet on [etherscan](https://etherscan.io/), especially the first funding tx. (`etherscan.io/address/paste-here`)

![Fill here if you open from etherscan.io](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pmIIKzi7Y8YSRghn-U26j.png?height=269&width=879)

* Check on etherscan whether the wallet is involved with another theft/scammersâ€™ wallet (more details in the next section).
* Check the funderâ€™s wallet on etherscan, foundation, opensea and repeat it from the step above.

![Example of reported wallet on Foundation](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7g3JN2cB3K1cCnINDn_Az.png?height=843&width=1919)

If you catch any red flags from above, Iâ€™d suggest to avoid them first and give them time to clarify.

### 4. Etherscan Tagging (Idea from Caleb)

This is where Calebâ€™s idea comes in handy for me (eventually for all of us too in the future) to quick check wallets when I discover another suspicious wallet.

So hereâ€™s how it works:

* I do research on many artists
* I will provide sources with evidence if I expose any art theft (will be updated on my [art theft list tweet](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1535538966425874434?s=20&t=TReIyV7VUgFcV9woGhCIgA))
* Tag/mention Etherscan or ping Caleb and they will help put a Tag for the theftsâ€™ wallet based on my source to be displayed as â€œArtist_Impersonatorâ€ on etherscan (naming might be subject to change).

![Example of tagged thief's wallet looks like on etherscan](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dFQ79VBFh6M5KYZZwO-nT.jpg?height=327&width=709)

![Example of tagged thief's wallets history on etherscan](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ef_XcvXV6wrAdf5BbiK1F.jpg?height=153&width=647)

How does this help me and the community ?

* Iâ€™m surfing etherscan a lot when doing these due diligence.
* Of course Iâ€™m checking the wallet history whether the wallet was funded by another scammer/thief wallet or not.
* Rather than remembering each thiefâ€™s wallet addresses with random numbers (0xâ€¦) and checking every wallets, seeing the tag â€œArtist Impersonatorâ€ straight will save my time by A LOT.
* My time saved a lot and I will do my mission faster.
* Mission done faster means Caleb can put the Tag also faster.
* The thiefâ€™s wallet tagged faster means the public will see the tag before they buy a stolen art.

If the stage above is successful, I hope people start to standardize checking certain person's wallets to see whether they got Tagged or not **BUT** also remember that if a thief didnâ€™t get tagged that doesnâ€™t mean they are safe, could be me being not active at the time or didnâ€™t pass by that theft on my end. I will do my best and strive for it, that is why my mission is to make the space safer and I really believe convenience is the first step to achieve it, hence what Calebâ€™s idea does have really aligned with me.

Caleb also graciously helped proof-read this writing and generously gave me the permission to release this Mirror without any splitting. As a thank you, I will gift a 1/1 later and I hope we can build more amazing stuff for the community in the next chapter.

> *Now this place is out of the map, the underground will no longer about due diligence. You may leave if you want agents, cheers.*

## YOUR TURN

Congrats you have made it here!

You have read and learned all the steps above all the way down, its time for you to spread the words and gatekeep all the bad actors.

### Alert Your Friends

This time its about how you deal wisely with thieves you catch later on, *\*besides just ignoring them\**.

Before you tell your friend, before you make a tweet, before you ping your community in discord, I have tips on how to maximize convenience (*again*) when making a public alert.

* When announcing a thief web3 account with link, always put their wallet address on the link instead of username.

  `Lets put myself as an example.`
  `Dont: foundation.app/@yun`
  `Do: foundation.app/0x010d7eAfceC7589832aca1170aEb23d21951D396`

  `Dont: opensea.io/yunyuliart`
  `Do: opensea.io/0x010d7eAfceC7589832aca1170aEb23d21951D396`
* Username can be easily changed at any time, while their wallet address won't change.
* With that, your source will be reliable. Links will always be correctly linked to the thiefâ€™s account even if they change username.

## CLOSING

I think thatâ€™s all at least for now, these are all been in my mind for months. Iâ€™m happy to finally be able to voice out my concern, and I know this is not the end, the space will have a competition to cover each lacks, build on top of each other, aggregate each other or the community itself will keep improving to make the ideal place that is decentralized while still secure from art thefts.

This mirror is just the beginning, these are not perfect yet to be called a guide but itâ€™s better to start one and hear feedback rather than waiting for each other and have no improvement towards the community.

Lastly, I apologize for my bad english and my messy writing. I still often use google translate, doubled down with writing as my least expertise in my art journey. I most of the time bad at communicating stuff and thatâ€™s part of the reason I make art through illustration.

However, I appreciated all the supports if you liked my writing or my art! Sharing it is highly appreciated as well!

Again, Thank you so much for being here with me!

> . . .

> *Yun has been disconnected . . .*

title: Reef â€” Blockchain yang Mendukung Next-Gen Dapps
body:
Ketika kami menerapkan versi Canary dari Mainnet Reef Chain, kami mengarahkan pandangan kami untuk menyediakan Jaringan Blockchain Blockchain Berkinerja Tinggi yang disesuaikan untuk DeFi, NFT , dan juga Aplikasi Game, Yang akan membantu para mengembang untuk mewujudkan potenti penuh dari Dapps nya...

Saat ini, ReefChain jauh lebih baik. Hari ini, kami sedang mengembangkan seluruh Ekosistem yang desentral di Ruang lingkup ReefChain.

Tetapi sebelum masuk ke detail, Mari kita melihat sedikit dasar-dasarnya.

**Apa itu ReefChain?**

Reef Chain adalah Blockchain Lapisan 1 , Akronim REEF sendiri dalam bahasa Indonesia adalah (Handal, Diperluas, Efisien dan Cepat) Jaringan REEF telah dirancang untuk mendukung Generasi Terbaru Dari DeFi, NFT maupun Gaming.

ReefChain telah dikembangkan menggunakan Substrate, Kerangka kerja Modern untuk inovasi Blockchain. Kami telah menggabungkan fitur terbaik dari Blockchain yang paling umum digunakan bersamaan dengan kemajuan terbaru dalam kriptografi untuk menawarkan Pengalaman pengguna kelas Dunia melalui reefchain.

**Konsensus NPoS untuk Skalabilitas Yang Tinggi**

ReefChain menyediakan Skalabilitas yang tinggi, Memungkinkan Transaksi hampir instant dengan biaya yang sangat Rendah, Terlepas dari banyaknya Transaksi. Tidak peduli seberapa Padat transaksi di jaringan Reef , Biaya Gas tidak akan menguras kantong anda

Ini disediakan melalui Algoritma konsensus Nominated Proof of Stake (NPoS) yang tidak akan menghasilkan Penambangan yang sia-sia, Tetapi mendukung Skalabilitas yang jauh lebih tinggi dibandingkan dengan Bitcoin dan Proof Of Work Ethereum. NPoS melibatkan 2 peran berbeda :

**Validator** : Menjaga Jaringan tetap berjalan dengan memproduksi dan memvalidasi blok baru. Mereka bertanggung jawab atas pemeliharaan dan keamanan jaringan, dan mendapat Reward Blok atas kerja mereka 

**Nominator** : Secara Ekonomi mendukung Validator dengan cara Staking Token Mereka demi Validator pilihan . Sebagai imbalan, Validator membagikan sebagian Reward Yang diterima kepada nominator 

Baca lebih lanjut tentang peran Validator dan Nominator di Ekosistem Reefchain [disini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/governance/staking/) 

**Kompatibilitas EVM**

ReefChain Kompatibel dengan EVM dan Mendukung Solidity. Pengembang DApp dapat dengan Mudah migrasi Dapps dari ethereum ke ReefChain tanpa perubahan apapun dalam Kode Dasar, memungkinkan Mereka untuk menikmati transaksi yang lebih tinggi dan Penyimpanan Blockchain yang efisien, ini disediakan oleh Reefchain

Kalian Dapat dengan mudah menerapkan versi Wrapped dari Token Erc-20 yang sudah ada di Reef dan mentransfer liquiditas antara Ethereum dan Reefchain Melalui jembatas Likuiditas/Cross chain Liquidity. Anda juga dapat membuat NFT sendiri dan Token lainnya di ReefChain.

**Tata Kelola Komunitas**

ReefChain telah dirancang dengan memperhatikan kemampuan Peningkatan Berkala dan tata Kelola berkelanjutan dalam jangka panjang. Tanggung jawab yang terkait dengan Tata kelola Jaringan telah dibagi menjadi dua kelompok, diantaranya :

**Dewan Teknis** , Yang bertanggung jawab untuk meninjau dan menyetujui pembaruan Blockchain, Dan dipilih melalui Bukti Komitmen

**Validator** , yang bertanggung jawab atas pemeliharaan dan keamanan jaringan, dan dipilih melalui NPoS

ReefChain dapat diupgrade mandiri. Fitur baru, pembaruan keamanan, dan optimalisasi kinerja, setelah disetujui oleh Dewan Teknis, diterapkan melalui pembaruan terjadwal. Hard fork tidak diperlukan, tidak seperti beberapa jaringan blockchain populer lainnya.

Anda dapat Staking token $REEF Anda untuk berpartisipasi dalam validasi dan tata kelola ReefChain (Governance), dan mendapatkan hadiah dari token yang Anda staking.

Baca lebih lanjut tentang tata kelola rantai terumbu [disini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/governance/upgrades/)

Kami juga telah mengembangkan sejumlah alat dan aplikasi, seperti dompet, DEX, dan NFT. Lihat penawaran terbaru kami [di sini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/users/ecosystem/)

Jangan lupa untuk mengikuti REEF di saluran berikut:

Situs web: https://reef.io

Twitter: https://twitter.com/Reef_Chain

title: artificial biology | #1of1xtz
body:
## notes and observations from a parallel biome | generated on midjourney

**1 of 1s now on [objkt](https://objkt.com/collection/KT1T1vRBxeo7NuL4o3j8CR7XNGZjw7aHgBdP)**

As a full time scientist, youâ€™d imagine that I spend a lot of time marveling at the expansiveness of our living world. I wish that were the case. The truth is that there are a lot of structures in formal (academic) scienceâ€¦ or maybe itâ€™s that thereâ€™s a high tendency to forge structures out of fluid systems.

As a historically masculine discipline, biology has not been allowed to be *pretty* in a very long time. Yet, there are interactions within and between biological entities that operate so successfully on the spectrum of grace and flamboyance-- as stewards, shouldnâ€™t it be our responsibility to appreciate this beauty on a public stage? 

Using midjourneyAI, I created this collection with intention to appreciate biological forms. I think when you work with a prompt-based AI, thatâ€™s the best way to describe the outputâ€¦ abstractions, forms, suggestions. Yet, itâ€™s the fact that these shapes are not true to the biology we know that I hope offers you a new lens into a space that has been overly characterized, and overly observed, and overly structured.

To those who might end up with these unique editions, thank you & may you love science for the way it exists beyond our observation.

### colophon

All parts were generated using [MidJourneyAI](https://www.midjourney.com/) and collaged together. Theyâ€™ve been listed as 1 of 1 editions for July 2022â€™s [1of1xtz](https://twitter.com/1of1xtz).

You can also [grab the moodboard](https://objkt.com/asset/KT1T1vRBxeo7NuL4o3j8CR7XNGZjw7aHgBdP/0) I used for this project which features some personal notes alongside figures from Earnst Haeckel, Franz Baur, and The Codex Seraphinanus. 1,111ed available for 0.11xtz.

![artificial biology // moodboard \[ 1111ed, 0.11xtz \]](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5R_lpJc2PbvJeOYR3Pjai.jpg?height=1491&width=2386)

### supplementary materials

This time Iâ€™ve got books:

Where the Crawdads Sing by Delia Owens, People in the Trees by Hanya Yanagihara, Braiding Sweetgrass by Robin Wall Kimmerer


---

### about

Talyssa uses â€œPhD candidate in Microbiologyâ€ as her opening line in every bio that matters; however, like many constituents of academia these days, she is on the quest to find her *plat de rÃ©sistance*. If youâ€™re interested in keeping up, you can find her [in other places.](https://talyssa.carrd.co/)

*Hi! Thanks for making it to the bottom of the page :)*

title: ECOOLSKA: Phygital fashionâ€™s pristine queen of green
body:
Caught between two worlds, ECOOLSKA - a pioneering phygital fashion brand - is all about longevity, sustainability and a chic, electric-green bob of a haircut that the meta me wishes she could pull off. 

ECOOLSKAâ€™s online presence exudes a unique breed of confidence I havenâ€™t witnessed in a while. They are all about pushing the boundaries of eco-friendly fashion. 

But more than that, they possess enough creative courage to modify traditional fabrics using materials like algae as well as execute an eloquent technique when it comes to dabbling in the metaverse with their avatar Olska - their Co-Founder and CEO Olska Greenâ€™s digital twin - all whilst pushing the motive of a cleaner, greener Pale Blue Dot (the late astronomer Carl Saganâ€™s pet name for planet earth).Â 

## Green without envyÂ 

![Olska Green rocking digital clothing and sneakers. (Credit: ECOOLSKA)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HdCHpgYcYNWOhhzkmK2wm.jpeg?height=4032&width=3024)

Thereâ€™s no doubt that ECOOLSKAâ€™s online presence is bold, loud and proud. Clicking through their [website](https://ecoolska.com/en/), there is a wealth of information, statistics and infographics which point to the brandâ€™s ethos of educating, reusing and recycling. 

So much so, itâ€™s even embedded in their name.Â Â 

â€œECOOLSKA, where the â€˜ecoâ€™ stands for ecology and â€˜Olskaâ€™ stands for the name of our 3D avatar, our brand ambassador and Co-Founder of ECOOLSKA,â€ they said.Â 

And Olska couldnâ€™t be a more perfect embodiment of the future of fashion. Sheâ€™s made of digital art and coded logic. Plus, meta fashion dominates her wardrobe.Â 

![Olska, the 3D avatar (Credit: ECOOLSKA)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qHwLsnItE0EXZEfNN5Orj.png?height=2000&width=2000)

â€œOlska illustrates the idea of eco-fashion, digital fashion and circular economy,â€ ECOOLSKA said. â€œWe are for quality items that will not go to the landfill in a few months, but will serve a purpose for many years.â€

â€œWe choose natural organic, biodegradable, innovative and recycled fabrics. Three uneven circles symbolise the three components of green principles of sustainable development: economy, people, environment.â€

Tackling the climate crisis starts from within however, and so ECOOLSKA has honed their focus on reducing their very own carbon footprint when it comes to their production processes.

â€œWe choose only certified biodegradable, innovative, recycled materials,â€ they said. â€œBtw, we are planning to create sportswear made from algae. Thatâ€™s a totally new, 100% biodegradable material made from seaweed.â€

â€œAlso, we work only with trusted suppliers and provide transparent information on fabrics, suppliers, partners and logistics. We sew our collections from certified fabrics only. We implement a cyclical economy and zero-waste production.â€

This push for pure sustainability and planet appreciation also extends beyond the environment, further encapsulating those who inhabit it.

â€œWe are all for a person accepting themselves as they are - without social media filters, masks and Photoshop. We stand for a culture of acceptance and care. We value all people in the diversity of their cultures and forms of expression.â€ 

ECOOLSKA also incorporates the 17 United Nations Sustainable Development Goals in their business practices as well as supporting charities who aim to reforest our planet with lush greens.Â 

## 3\[D\]evelopment beyond dimensionÂ 

With the rapid rise of digital fashion as a plausible answer to eco-friendly fashion consumption, ECOOLSKA hopped at the opportunity to develop their brand within this space too.Â 

â€œVery soon, with the help of 3D technology, everyone will be able to buy digital clothes for themselves without having to necessarily break the bankâ€, ECOOLSKA said. â€œYou can post photos on social networks in new outfits every day. This will eliminate the need to buy physical clothing in large quantities.â€

â€œEveryone will have enough space in their wardrobe for several comfortable, high-quality, weather-resistant sets. The need for novelty and the propensity for shopaholism can be met through digital fashion. We believe that this is the future.â€

Transferring their physical values into the digital realm, ECOOLSKA created their â€œRecycle Your Lifeâ€ collection which consisted of garments made entirely from preloved clothes. â€œAs far as this collection goes, it is total upcycling,â€ ECOOLSKA said. 

![One of the looks from the "Recycle Your Life" collection (Credit: ECOOLSKA)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/w6FaUFkyXjc2l-MmXOxCz.jpg?height=789&width=671)

â€œThe outfits were made in single pieces. This is because you canâ€™t buy the same garments in secondhand shops. The clothes were handmade by Olska. We then decided to prolong the lives of the outfits and thus, this collection was digitised.â€

![The digitised version of one of the looks from the "Recycle Your Life" collection (Credit: ECOOLSKA)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jiD-JxMQqsHoslTSvgkwU.jpg?height=4000&width=4000)

Going a step further, Olskaâ€™s digital twin is making a double impact in fashionâ€™s future. Her personality and eco-education are the two key ingredients to ensuring the digital fashion message of sustainability and accessibility are catapulted to the top of every agenda.Â 

â€œOlska popularises the idea of digital fashion. On each post and in every video, she wears our digital outfits to promote the idea of utility within digital fashion. We believe that we can develop a sustainable society through art and fashion,â€ ECOOLSKA said. 

â€œBesides her [Insta account](https://www.instagram.com/olska3d/), we produce amazing [dialogues](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYbYwqk-zL8) with her and our Co-Founder (literally real, physical dialogues) and while talking, they cover different topics such as sustainability, fashion innovation, future fashion as well as the future of peopleâ€™s attitude towards the fashion industry and consumerism in general.â€

![Olska, 3D avatar (left) and Co-Founder Olska Green (right) (Credit: ECOOLSKA)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aqC1MNDGimSyr9QnhEW_w.JPG?height=1220&width=913)

Digitising garments for online and social media use is not the only massive disrupter to the fashion industry. Teleporting fashion shows and other community gatherings to the metaverse is the necessary next step to future proof the industry.Â 

â€œFor a digital show, you do not waste money and resources like on staff salaries or for sewing samples or decorations, for example,â€ ECOOLSKA said. â€œYou do not have to send invitations out to guests. Or people do not need to fly all the way from across the world to see your show.â€ 

â€œYou can create a digital show, a very realistic one, and include 3D avatars. Ideally, an offline show would be presented only after the approval of the collection. We have recently released our second digital fashion show with the [MAMMAMIA](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=68wPzbutbl4) collection.â€Â 

This movement in fashion goes beyond acceptingÂ  3D as a temporary fad or trend. It is the future and the way forward to create a culture of inclusivity whilst simultaneously garnering a planet-centric consciousness.Â 

![Co-Founder Olska Green wearing a piece from the "Recycle Your Life" collection](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/na9dCYFbNG8VgxJl449OE.jpg?height=5472&width=3648)

â€œWe truly believe that virtual fashion plays a significant part in transforming our reality. The opportunity to showcase a runway with 3D mannequins enables us to decrease the amount of waste and save resources, money and time,â€ said ECOOLSKA.Â 

To be honest and fair, this brand has completely windswept me away. And that doesnâ€™t happen very often. Oath.

Beyond their macro industry-changing narrative, ECOOLSKA revealed a personal touch that makes their inner workings truly unique . 

â€œI love everything extravagant, interesting, breathtaking and extraordinary,â€ they said. â€œI was inspired by the green movement. The colour green represents the commitment to the green economy and the synergy between nature and human beings.â€

My conclusion? ECOOLSKA is unbelievably cool. Beyond revolutionising the fashion industry, they have embedded eco-friendly educational practices into the fabric of new-age consumerism. I mean, the word â€œcoolâ€ is even in their name. 

Coincidence? I think not.Â 

***Connect with ECOOLSKA on Twitter [here](https://twitter.com/ecoolska) and Instagram [here](https://www.instagram.com/ecoolska_official/).***

title: Reef â€” Blockchain yang Mendukung Next-Gen Dapps
body:
Ketika kami menerapkan versi Canary dari Mainnet Reef Chain, kami mengarahkan pandangan kami untuk menyediakan Jaringan Blockchain Blockchain Berkinerja Tinggi yang disesuaikan untuk DeFi, NFT , dan juga Aplikasi Game, Yang akan membantu para mengembang untuk mewujudkan potenti penuh dari Dapps nya...

Saat ini, ReefChain jauh lebih baik. Hari ini, kami sedang mengembangkan seluruh Ekosistem yang desentral di Ruang lingkup ReefChain.

Tetapi sebelum masuk ke detail, Mari kita melihat sedikit dasar-dasarnya.

**Apa itu ReefChain?**

Reef Chain adalah Blockchain Lapisan 1 , Akronim REEF sendiri dalam bahasa Indonesia adalah (Handal, Diperluas, Efisien dan Cepat) Jaringan REEF telah dirancang untuk mendukung Generasi Terbaru Dari DeFi, NFT maupun Gaming.

ReefChain telah dikembangkan menggunakan Substrate, Kerangka kerja Modern untuk inovasi Blockchain. Kami telah menggabungkan fitur terbaik dari Blockchain yang paling umum digunakan bersamaan dengan kemajuan terbaru dalam kriptografi untuk menawarkan Pengalaman pengguna kelas Dunia melalui reefchain.

**Konsensus NPoS untuk Skalabilitas Yang Tinggi**

ReefChain menyediakan Skalabilitas yang tinggi, Memungkinkan Transaksi hampir instant dengan biaya yang sangat Rendah, Terlepas dari banyaknya Transaksi. Tidak peduli seberapa Padat transaksi di jaringan Reef , Biaya Gas tidak akan menguras kantong anda

Ini disediakan melalui Algoritma konsensus Nominated Proof of Stake (NPoS) yang tidak akan menghasilkan Penambangan yang sia-sia, Tetapi mendukung Skalabilitas yang jauh lebih tinggi dibandingkan dengan Bitcoin dan Proof Of Work Ethereum. NPoS melibatkan 2 peran berbeda :

**Validator** : Menjaga Jaringan tetap berjalan dengan memproduksi dan memvalidasi blok baru. Mereka bertanggung jawab atas pemeliharaan dan keamanan jaringan, dan mendapat Reward Blok atas kerja mereka 

**Nominator** : Secara Ekonomi mendukung Validator dengan cara Staking Token Mereka demi Validator pilihan . Sebagai imbalan, Validator membagikan sebagian Reward Yang diterima kepada nominator 

Baca lebih lanjut tentang peran Validator dan Nominator di Ekosistem Reefchain [disini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/governance/staking/) 

**Kompatibilitas EVM**

ReefChain Kompatibel dengan EVM dan Mendukung Solidity. Pengembang DApp dapat dengan Mudah migrasi Dapps dari ethereum ke ReefChain tanpa perubahan apapun dalam Kode Dasar, memungkinkan Mereka untuk menikmati transaksi yang lebih tinggi dan Penyimpanan Blockchain yang efisien, ini disediakan oleh Reefchain

Kalian Dapat dengan mudah menerapkan versi Wrapped dari Token Erc-20 yang sudah ada di Reef dan mentransfer liquiditas antara Ethereum dan Reefchain Melalui jembatas Likuiditas/Cross chain Liquidity. Anda juga dapat membuat NFT sendiri dan Token lainnya di ReefChain.

**Tata Kelola Komunitas**

ReefChain telah dirancang dengan memperhatikan kemampuan Peningkatan Berkala dan tata Kelola berkelanjutan dalam jangka panjang. Tanggung jawab yang terkait dengan Tata kelola Jaringan telah dibagi menjadi dua kelompok, diantaranya :

**Dewan Teknis** , Yang bertanggung jawab untuk meninjau dan menyetujui pembaruan Blockchain, Dan dipilih melalui Bukti Komitmen

**Validator** , yang bertanggung jawab atas pemeliharaan dan keamanan jaringan, dan dipilih melalui NPoS

ReefChain dapat diupgrade mandiri. Fitur baru, pembaruan keamanan, dan optimalisasi kinerja, setelah disetujui oleh Dewan Teknis, diterapkan melalui pembaruan terjadwal. Hard fork tidak diperlukan, tidak seperti beberapa jaringan blockchain populer lainnya.

Anda dapat Staking token $REEF Anda untuk berpartisipasi dalam validasi dan tata kelola ReefChain (Governance), dan mendapatkan hadiah dari token yang Anda staking.

Baca lebih lanjut tentang tata kelola rantai terumbu [disini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/governance/upgrades/)

Kami juga telah mengembangkan sejumlah alat dan aplikasi, seperti dompet, DEX, dan NFT. Lihat penawaran terbaru kami [di sini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/users/ecosystem/)

Jangan lupa untuk mengikuti REEF di saluran berikut:

Situs web: https://reef.io

Twitter: https://twitter.com/Reef_Chain

title: My First Publication
body:
Hi Mirror.xyz community. My name is AndrÃ©, an upcoming senior majoring in Physics at Illinois Tech, Chicago. Iâ€™m tremendously passionate about scalable technologies that give power back to users, and aspire to be a web3 VC one day.

Hereâ€™s a snapshot of my journey so far:

* Started as a **Venture Associate @Kaplan Institute**, Illinois Tech (May 2021)
  * Created the first-ever Venture Capital Immersion Program in the history of Illinois Tech, [Genisys Program](https://www.iit.edu/kaplan/programs/genisys)
* [Minted my first NFT (November 2021)](https://opensea.io/assets/matic/0x2953399124f0cbb46d2cbacd8a89cf0599974963/68733812083682386214578334512960508434791882495791469790509043788946604032001/)
* Was selected as a **GenZScout** (January-May 2022)
* Venture Fellow **@Republic** (March - July 2022)
  * Created a thesis on the investment potential of [DeFi in Latin America](https://www.notion.so/andrguardia/The-Decentralized-Future-of-Latin-American-Fintech-ac4a54662e3b486fb2ceb58093477b73)
* **Blueprint Investor Track** @DormRoomFund (June 2022 - Present)
* Iâ€™m currently a **Venture Analyst Intern @Decasonic** (June 2022 - Present), where I am intensely learning about DAOs, DeFi, and incubating two concepts for web3 projects.

Iâ€™m looking forward to becoming a full-time web3 VC Analyst by the time I graduate college, so I will be using this mirror account to post my learnings and updates!

Thatâ€™s about it

title: on refleksiviti
body:
### how can one understand that the Iliad and the Odyssey are written, if their author is not familiar with the practice of the writing? The "Homeric Question" was born.

At its core, qualitative research enables researchers to gain a complete understanding of a topic through truthful reporting and firsthand knowledge. To ensure the accuracy of this type of research, it is helpful to work with coded data, meaning that the information should be organized and labeled to identify various relationships and themes.

Once the data is coded, you can be reflexive. Typically, reflexivity involves examining your own judgments, practices, and belief systems during the data collection process. The goal of being reflexive is to identify any personal beliefs that may have incidentally affected the research.

Government cultural policies, notably in Europe and more specifically in France, are mainly steered toward the democratization of culture. They **aim to disseminate major cultural works to an audience that does not have ready access to them, for lack of financial means or knowledge derived from education**.

During the 19th and early 20th centuries, Homer research was dominated by the debates between Unitarians and analysts, the latter in particular having the upper hand. A particularly influential publication was the Prolegomena ad Homerum (1795) of the German classicist Friedrich August Wolf (1759-1824). He noted in this preliminary study to his edition of the Iliad that Homer never made any mention of the writing process or read. The only exception (to a set of 28,000 verses) is found in song 6 (verses 168- 169), but according to Wolf, the term ÏƒÎ®Î¼Î±Ï„Î± refers (not Î³ÏÎ¬Î¼Î¼Î±Ï„Î±!) there not to 'characters' but to 'meaningful symbols'. Apart from that, the constant absence of references to reading and writing in both the Iliad and the Odyssey determined remarkable: no mention of a inscription on a column or grave, of a coin with inscription, of a letter or written messenger. Instead, everything turns out to be focused on listening and the oral tradition â€“ hence the importance of the Muses, daughters of Mnemosyne. This observation, of course, brings a fundamental problem with it: **how can one understand that the Iliad and the Odyssey are written, if their author is not familiar with the practice of the writing? The "Homeric Question" was born.**

![A student approached Zen Master RyÅkan and asked, â€œMaster, will you please write a poem for me?â€ RyÅkan agreed and wrote the following:
The mind is like a mirror;
It collects dust when not in use.

The student thanked the master and went on his way.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fiWSqCc0JXZzUF6mTfPs0.png?height=1500&width=964)

In 2022 it seems almost impossible to preserve a form of individuality in a scattering mass culture, in which at least one impulse from another can always be discerned. And at the same time, it is precisely in a world that is dying of fragmentation and loneliness that we have to build collectivity and togetherness. Is it more difficult or easier today than before to work alone?


In A History of Solitude (2020), David Vincent describes the origin of the term solitude in the eighteenth century. While in the Enlightenment loneliness was seen as a danger, or a religious aberration (living in seclusion and silence), the Romantics saw it as a blessing: as a means to come to oneself and to experience a deep freedom. Being alone became a privilege to be pursued. In A Biography of Loneliness (2019), Fay Bound Alberti connects the emergence of loneliness â€“ as a problem â€“ with increasing secularization: as long as there was a God to turn to, you could never be completely alone. Prolonged loneliness has serious, also physical consequences. But the solutions that are offered â€“ individual community projects, in England a real minister of loneliness â€“ are symbolic politics, as long as public libraries and bus connections are casually closed due to budget cuts.

[https://twitter.com/ianpostsforyou/status/1542320515267928064](https://twitter.com/ianpostsforyou/status/1542320515267928064)

Hisoka Morow (ãƒ’ã‚½ã‚«=ãƒ¢ãƒ­ã‚¦, *Hisoka MorÅu*) is a magician and serial killer who combines magic tricks with violence, and delights in battling those he considers strong to the point of sexual arousal.\[[ch.Â 5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Hunter_%C3%97_Hunter_characters#ch.5), [61](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Hunter_%C3%97_Hunter_characters#ch.61)\] He is deceitful, playful, and narcissistic by nature, acting only in his own self-interest. In the manga, his sentences typically end with a [suit symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suit_(cards)). Hisoka takes an interest in Gon and his friends after encountering them during the Hunter Exam, letting them live so that they grow into more worthy opponents.\[[ch.Â 28](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Hunter_%C3%97_Hunter_characters#ch.28)\] Although he is initially positioned as an antagonist due to his affinity towards murder, he occasionally acts as a comrade to Gon, when it suits his own interests.

title: Reef â€” Blockchain yang Mendukung Next-Gen Dapps
body:
Ketika kami menerapkan versi Canary dari Mainnet Reef Chain, kami mengarahkan pandangan kami untuk menyediakan Jaringan Blockchain Berkinerja Tinggi yang disesuaikan untuk DeFi, NFT , dan juga Aplikasi Game, Yang akan membantu para mengembang untuk mewujudkan potenti penuh dari Dapps nya...

Saat ini, ReefChain jauh lebih baik. Hari ini, kami sedang mengembangkan seluruh Ekosistem yang desentral di Ruang lingkup ReefChain.

Tetapi sebelum masuk ke detail, Mari kita melihat sedikit dasar-dasarnya.

**Apa itu ReefChain?**

Reef Chain adalah Blockchain Lapisan 1 , Akronim REEF sendiri dalam bahasa Indonesia adalah (Handal, Diperluas, Efisien dan Cepat) Jaringan REEF telah dirancang untuk mendukung Generasi Terbaru Dari DeFi, NFT maupun Gaming.

ReefChain telah dikembangkan menggunakan Substrate, Kerangka kerja Modern untuk inovasi Blockchain. Kami telah menggabungkan fitur terbaik dari Blockchain yang paling umum digunakan bersamaan dengan kemajuan terbaru dalam kriptografi untuk menawarkan Pengalaman pengguna kelas Dunia melalui reefchain.

**Konsensus NPoS untuk Skalabilitas Yang Tinggi**

ReefChain menyediakan Skalabilitas yang tinggi, Memungkinkan Transaksi hampir instant dengan biaya yang sangat Rendah, Terlepas dari banyaknya Transaksi. Tidak peduli seberapa Padat transaksi di jaringan Reef , Biaya Gas tidak akan menguras kantong anda

Ini disediakan melalui Algoritma konsensus Nominated Proof of Stake (NPoS) yang tidak akan menghasilkan Penambangan yang sia-sia, Tetapi mendukung Skalabilitas yang jauh lebih tinggi dibandingkan dengan Bitcoin dan Proof Of Work Ethereum. NPoS melibatkan 2 peran berbeda :

**Validator** : Menjaga Jaringan tetap berjalan dengan memproduksi dan memvalidasi blok baru. Mereka bertanggung jawab atas pemeliharaan dan keamanan jaringan, dan mendapat Reward Blok atas kerja mereka

**Nominator** : Secara Ekonomi mendukung Validator dengan cara Staking Token Mereka demi Validator pilihan . Sebagai imbalan, Validator membagikan sebagian Reward Yang diterima kepada nominator

Baca lebih lanjut tentang peran Validator dan Nominator di Ekosistem Reefchain [disini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/governance/staking/)

**Kompatibilitas EVM**

ReefChain Kompatibel dengan EVM dan Mendukung Solidity. Pengembang DApp dapat dengan Mudah migrasi Dapps dari ethereum ke ReefChain tanpa perubahan apapun dalam Kode Dasar, memungkinkan Mereka untuk menikmati transaksi yang lebih tinggi dan Penyimpanan Blockchain yang efisien, ini disediakan oleh Reefchain

Kalian Dapat dengan mudah menerapkan versi Wrapped dari Token Erc-20 yang sudah ada di Reef dan mentransfer liquiditas antara Ethereum dan Reefchain Melalui jembatas Likuiditas/Cross chain Liquidity. Anda juga dapat membuat NFT sendiri dan Token lainnya di ReefChain.

**Tata Kelola Komunitas**

ReefChain telah dirancang dengan memperhatikan kemampuan Peningkatan Berkala dan tata Kelola berkelanjutan dalam jangka panjang. Tanggung jawab yang terkait dengan Tata kelola Jaringan telah dibagi menjadi dua kelompok, diantaranya :

**Dewan Teknis** , Yang bertanggung jawab untuk meninjau dan menyetujui pembaruan Blockchain, Dan dipilih melalui Bukti Komitmen

**Validator** , yang bertanggung jawab atas pemeliharaan dan keamanan jaringan, dan dipilih melalui NPoS

ReefChain dapat diupgrade mandiri. Fitur baru, pembaruan keamanan, dan optimalisasi kinerja, setelah disetujui oleh Dewan Teknis, diterapkan melalui pembaruan terjadwal. Hard fork tidak diperlukan, tidak seperti beberapa jaringan blockchain populer lainnya.

Anda dapat Staking token $REEF Anda untuk berpartisipasi dalam validasi dan tata kelola ReefChain (Governance), dan mendapatkan hadiah dari token yang Anda staking.

Baca lebih lanjut tentang tata kelola rantai terumbu [disini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/governance/upgrades/)

Kami juga telah mengembangkan sejumlah alat dan aplikasi, seperti dompet, DEX, dan NFT. Lihat penawaran terbaru kami [di sini](https://docs.reef.io/docs/users/ecosystem/)

Jangan lupa untuk mengikuti REEF di saluran berikut:

Situs web: https://reef.io

Twitter: https://twitter.com/Reef_Chain

title: on refleksiviti
body:
### how can one understand that the Iliad and the Odyssey are written, if their author is not familiar with the practice of the writing? The "Homeric Question" was born.

At its core, qualitative research enables researchers to gain a complete understanding of a topic through truthful reporting and firsthand knowledge. To ensure the accuracy of this type of research, it is helpful to work with coded data, meaning that the information should be organized and labeled to identify various relationships and themes.

Once the data is coded, you can be reflexive. Typically, reflexivity involves examining your own judgments, practices, and belief systems during the data collection process. The goal of being reflexive is to identify any personal beliefs that may have incidentally affected the research.

Government cultural policies, notably in Europe and more specifically in France, are mainly steered toward the democratization of culture. They **aim to disseminate major cultural works to an audience that does not have ready access to them, for lack of financial means or knowledge derived from education**.

During the 19th and early 20th centuries, Homer research was dominated by the debates between Unitarians and analysts, the latter in particular having the upper hand. A particularly influential publication was the Prolegomena ad Homerum (1795) of the German classicist Friedrich August Wolf (1759-1824). He noted in this preliminary study to his edition of the Iliad that Homer never made any mention of the writing process or read. The only exception (to a set of 28,000 verses) is found in song 6 (verses 168- 169), but according to Wolf, the term ÏƒÎ®Î¼Î±Ï„Î± refers (not Î³ÏÎ¬Î¼Î¼Î±Ï„Î±!) there not to 'characters' but to 'meaningful symbols'. Apart from that, the constant absence of references to reading and writing in both the Iliad and the Odyssey determined remarkable: no mention of a inscription on a column or grave, of a coin with inscription, of a letter or written messenger. Instead, everything turns out to be focused on listening and the oral tradition â€“ hence the importance of the Muses, daughters of Mnemosyne. This observation, of course, brings a fundamental problem with it: **how can one understand that the Iliad and the Odyssey are written, if their author is not familiar with the practice of the writing? The "Homeric Question" was born.**

![A student approached Zen Master RyÅkan and asked, â€œMaster, will you please write a poem for me?â€ RyÅkan agreed and wrote the following:
The mind is like a mirror;
It collects dust when not in use.

The student thanked the master and went on his way.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fiWSqCc0JXZzUF6mTfPs0.png?height=1500&width=964)

In 2022 it seems almost impossible to preserve a form of individuality in a scattering mass culture, in which at least one impulse from another can always be discerned. And at the same time, it is precisely in a world that is dying of fragmentation and loneliness that we have to build collectivity and togetherness. Is it more difficult or easier today than before to work alone?


In A History of Solitude (2020), David Vincent describes the origin of the term solitude in the eighteenth century. While in the Enlightenment loneliness was seen as a danger, or a religious aberration (living in seclusion and silence), the Romantics saw it as a blessing: as a means to come to oneself and to experience a deep freedom. Being alone became a privilege to be pursued. In A Biography of Loneliness (2019), Fay Bound Alberti connects the emergence of loneliness â€“ as a problem â€“ with increasing secularization: as long as there was a God to turn to, you could never be completely alone. Prolonged loneliness has serious, also physical consequences. But the solutions that are offered â€“ individual community projects, in England a real minister of loneliness â€“ are symbolic politics, as long as public libraries and bus connections are casually closed due to budget cuts.

Hisoka Morow (ãƒ’ã‚½ã‚«=ãƒ¢ãƒ­ã‚¦, *Hisoka MorÅu*) is a magician and serial killer who combines magic tricks with violence, and delights in battling those he considers strong to the point of sexual arousal.\[[ch.Â 5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Hunter_%C3%97_Hunter_characters#ch.5), [61](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Hunter_%C3%97_Hunter_characters#ch.61)\] He is deceitful, playful, and narcissistic by nature, acting only in his own self-interest. In the manga, his sentences typically end with a [suit symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suit_(cards)). Hisoka takes an interest in Gon and his friends after encountering them during the Hunter Exam, letting them live so that they grow into more worthy opponents.\[[ch.Â 28](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Hunter_%C3%97_Hunter_characters#ch.28)\] Although he is initially positioned as an antagonist due to his affinity towards murder, he occasionally acts as a comrade to Gon, when it suits his own interests.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tIhVfYE99jFAjLM-rWk62.jpg?height=2795&width=4368)

title: Default Humans
body:
**THE ORIGIN**

The idea of Default Humans only came around to be when there was an increasing trend of NFTs in social avatar collections. Do you use social media a lot and often find yourself rarely having a proper social avatar to go along with your socials? (Twitter, Instagram, etc.)

That is where the idea of Default Humans emerged. Solely for the NFT bums, with the base avatar as only the Default Human icon, *like most social media have when you first create an account*;

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5NRBPTg8k2GgXFa69jYdN.png?height=1300&width=1600)

We have made use of our creativity to turn the icon into something more human-like, into Default Humans. We wanted this project to be simple, nothing more than your typical copy/paste roadmap, basic â€œutilityâ€ bullsh\*t, and live up to its reputation of it being â€œjust jpegsâ€.

**THE BENEFITS**

***1. Charitable Project*** ğŸ’™ğŸ«‚

Even if this is a simple project, we still have goals and there are still benefits in holding a Human. We are a simple, but also a charitable project; Default Humans aims to give 20% of our profits to UNICEF in doing whatever it takes to save and protect the worldâ€™s most vulnerable children.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Qk6nHSCdUDokCGjt-0Aba.png?height=1416&width=2557)

***2. Exclusive Merch*** ğŸ‘•

Gain exclusive access to our upcoming **Good Humans Collection** while holding a Human! Only holders of the Default Humans NFT can gain access to the collection to purchase merch, including hoodies, t-shirts, hats & more!

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vM4-OcEbMgbE-KTq4euYX.jpg?height=1526&width=2844)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kKzm5FC1m1H8pJHOrpYU6.png?height=2500&width=3600)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aDh_2A_85dQKBXwbcwtcS.png?height=2500&width=3600)

***3. The Art*** ğŸ–¼

Default Humans is a cartoony, goofy-like representation of Humans that reside in the ecosystem of the Polygon network. Other collections may followâ€¦

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IPXOZ1oacjaMhFVFkYsyZ.png?height=800&width=1200)

***4. Full Commercial Rights*** ğŸ‘

You own all commercial rights to the images of all your Humans, including the right to make copies of, distribute, and otherwise commercially exploit the images, for any purpose.

***5. Solely for the NFT bums*** ğŸ™Š

Weâ€™re just hopping on the NFT bandwagon because we can, and because we believe we have what it takes to release a genuine collection, no matter the outcome. Default Humans NFT is not for everyone, and thatâ€™s what makes it special. If youâ€™re looking for something more serious, go look at Bored Ape. Or not, we donâ€™t care.

### Frequently Asked Questions

* **Why Default Humans?**
  * Solely for the NFT bums. If youâ€™re looking for something more serious, go look at Bored Ape. Or not, we donâ€™t care.
* **Why does your project not have much utility?**
  * We donâ€™t believe in having utility if thereâ€™s no plans in the foreseeable future. Unlike many projects who promise utility and fail to deliver at times, we promise very little.
* **How many NFTs will there be?**
  * A small collection of 500 Default Humans will be created and minted on the Polygon blockchain.
* **How much to mint a Human?**
  * Humans will be listed at 0.009 ETH per mint.
* **Will there be Whitelisting?**

title: Rebuild the Internet Narrative (Part 1)
body:
Whatâ€™s a better Internet?

Many people will say: Web3.

Itâ€™s so viral that you simply canâ€™t avoid it. The reason why I write about it isnâ€™t to freeload, but to discuss something serious. I want to help you understand: What is Web3? Why is it emerging now? What criticism does it face?

Coinbase, one of the best crypto exchanges, once explained in an article, â€œWeb3â€™s defining feature is ownership. Whereas the first iteration of the commercial Internet (Web 1.0) was read-only for most users, and Web 2.0 allowed users to both read and write on centralized platforms (Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, etc), Web3 gives users full ownership over their content, data, and assets via blockchains. It empowers users to read-write-own.â€

This explanation is fair but not complete because it implies that Web3 is blockchain-based innovation. However, Web3 didnâ€™t emerge out of a sudden. It came into being via evolving narratives and ideas. Even to some extent, Web3 is exactly what the Internet pioneers aspired to build decades ago. We must trace back the history of the current Internet to understand Web3.

**Internet in its origins**

The open-source software movement and the hacker culture are nourishing todayâ€™s Internet. The pioneers believe that the Internet can help build a decentralized, equal and liberal society. However, when the computer was first invented and the Internet just dawned, computer science had a completely different meaning to the society back then.

Computer made a quite negative impression on the public because of its direct association with wars. Scientific researchers at the early stage of the Cold War were concerned that governments and capitalists would use computer as a manipulation tool and social institutions would fall prey.

Starting from the late 1950s, many scientists and philosophers began to oppose the "automated processes" represented by computers. In his book *The Myth of the Machine* (1967), [Lewis Mumford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lewis_Mumford) (1895-1990), one of the most acknowledged anti-automationists in the 1960s, stated,Â  â€œWith this new â€˜megatechnicsâ€™ the dominant minority will create a uniform, all-enveloping, super-planetary structure, designed for automatic operation. Instead of functioning actively as an autonomous personality, man will become a passive, purposeless, machine-conditioned animal whose proper functions, as technicians now interpret manâ€™s role, will either be fed into the machine or strictly limited and controlled for the benefit of de-personalized, collective organizations.â€

The Cold War era was shadowed by nuclear weapons. A new world war might befall at any time. When young people had to face the danger of being killed every day, they would instinctively contemplate about the purpose of self-existence. Also, it was a time of alienation - young people felt like cogs of the intricate machine known as social institution. They were programmed to follow the societal path - getting married, buying a property, having kids, getting a dog, and checking in all the other clearly defined â€œplaces of interestâ€ before death. However, some decided to defy the norms and break with the pipelined society to resolve the everyday banalities. As a result, the Hippie Movement, a counterculture movement, was born. A flock of hippies long to build a society where everyone lives an equal life, and many decentralized, self-governing organizations sprouted up, building tens of thousands of independent communes outside the cities based on religious beliefs, political orientations and sexualities. The contemporary American writer Fred Turner called these contrarians the â€œ[New Communalists](https://wiki.p2pfoundation.net/New_Communalism)â€.

Though these New Communalists lived far from the city, they didnâ€™t abandon modern lifestyles. They wanted to be producers and creators. They used all kinds of tools to build a convenient, communal environment. The heavy usage of tools made the communalists not at all tech-averse - at least less tech-averse than advocates in other social movements. Meanwhile, building a community from scratch required intense collaboration. The Communalists realized that computer automation could facilitate the collaboration. If used wisely, computer would serve not just the privileged, but the masses.

The discussion around tools began to gain attention. How to pick the right tool to finish the right task became a fad. To improve the communication about tools, Stewart Brand (1938-) founded Whole Earth Catalog (1968-1972). He operated the magazine as an open-source software developer - making accounts public, recommending various kinds of tools, and exchanging information with the Communalists.

For example, a 20-pound hammer. As one reader shared, â€œWhen I walked into the bathroom with a new 20-ounce hammer in my hand, I suddenly understood what the Whole Earth Catalog called â€˜toolsâ€™. I had always thought of tools as physical objects like screwdrivers, wrenches, axes, and hoes. Now I know a tool is a process - using an object of the right size and the right shape to get a job done in the most efficient way.â€

During the same period, computer began to downsize from being room-sized to desktop. Many Communalists started to think whether computer could empower individuals to produce and create. As a result, the term â€œpersonal computerâ€ came up in the early 1970s.

The computer narrative changed from â€œthe tool owned by social institutionsâ€ to â€œthe tool that every individual can ownâ€.

In June 1971, Brand held a farewell party for the Whole Earth Catalog. At the party, Brand passed $20,000 to the host, and the host said to the guests, â€œThis is exactly a tool that can be catalogued in the Whole Earth Catalog.â€ They wanted to discuss how to spend the money, however, despite the fifty-some proposals that the guests raised, no agreement was reached. After the party, the rest of money was given to [Frederick L. Moore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Moore_(activist)) (1941-1997). In the spring of 1975, Moore founded the Homebrew Computer Club.

Time Magazine called the Homebrew Computer Club â€œthe melting pot of the whole computer timeâ€. This club also inspired Apple being founded by Steve Jobs (1955-2011) and Steve Wozniak (1950-). So logically, the zeitgeist of anti-bureaucracy and civil liberty was infused into the publicity of Apple Macintosh in 1984 â€“ at least Steve Jobs himself was strongly motivated by the New Communalists.

These pioneersâ€™ quests for equality, liberty, personal empowerment and tool utilization were the brainwaves of their times, which set the scene for the advent of the Internet. In a 1995 special issue of the Time Magazine, Brand asserted, â€œThe personal computer revolution and the Internet had grown directly out of the coutnercultureâ€¦Forget antiwar protests, Woodstock, even long hair. The real legacy of the sixties generation is the computer revolution.â€ To them, computer transformed from a giant machine locked in a room to a personal tool - it was historic.

At that particular moment, the computer narrative completely changed. Computer started to belong to everybody.

So now when we trace the origin of cyberculture, we are led to find the same group of people - a group of hippies that lived under the shadow of the nuclear war, against the bureaucracy and in the communes, and their followers. Their goal was to reconfigure a part of the world so that the society could value equality, allow the free flow of information, and make everyone live up to their own beliefs. It led to a decentralized, individualistic utopia. Humanity is the goal, not the means.

Although these goals have never been fulfilled, they became the driving force of every new cybercultural movement after the information revolution - every new wave claimed to be more centred on personal empowerment and benefits than before. In retrospect, these movements maintain considerably high degrees of ideological consistency. This is a lasting dream for generations.

**Internet Shaped by Web 2.0**

The Web is probably the most significant product since the invention of the personal computer. A generation of tech pioneers had high hopes for the Internet, believing that it could pave the way for an ideal digital utopia. From this point onwards, information began to shift from the atomic world to the bit world. In 1992, a librarian coined the phrase â€œsurfing the Internetâ€. It perfectly describes there will be waves only if there is a constant flow of information.

However, at the time, the Internet was more of a one-way information stream. Not many users were able to build their own personal websites from scratch. People not familiar with the Web thought of it simply as another form of print media. At the end of the day, the Web only served a small crowd, just as most of the New Communalists were affluent, white middle-class Americans.

So there came Web 2.0. A new concept that allows users to interact with each other and to create content rather than just passively consume it. My first encounter with the Internet happened before the burst of Dot-com bubble - I didnâ€™t even understand the meaning of â€œbubbleâ€ at that time. When I began to project part of my life onto the Internet, Web 2.0 was still in its infancy; and it was originally introduced to me via an article in a print magazine. The concept seemed so organic, and I had faith that it would come to fruition. Since I was a child, no one took my thoughts seriously in real life, except on the Internet where I used pseudonyms. This was the reason that I had a positive outlook on the Internet, and itâ€™s also the inspiration that made me think why the Internet had been different before.

Evidently, what I thought of had some limitations. My pure desire was to connect with people whom I couldnâ€™t meet face-to-face. O'Reilly and Media International, which brought Web 2.0 to the public eye, believed that the Internet would facilitate a more democratic, decentralized distribution of information. According to Paul Graham, the founder of Y Combinator, Web 2.0 can be characterized with three features: interactivity enabled by Ajax technology, democracy, and â€œdonâ€™t maltreat usersâ€.

Itâ€™s obvious that democracy and empowerment emanated from the inventors of the Internet. However, in the wake of Web 2.0, a new narrative arose: the Internet didnâ€™t just gather cohorts of individuals, but summoned platforms as service providers. These service providers shouldnâ€™t â€œmaltreat the usersâ€. They should build a playground for everyone to create content.

Back then, no one suspected platforms would be a problem. On the contrary, platforms should be more favorable to users, because democracy embedded in the Internet enables a more user-friendly, interactive experience. The bible of the Internetâ€™s product development was Donâ€™t Make Me Think (2000), and the title of its Chinese version was literally Turn A Stone Into Gold: How To Design A Visitor-Oriented Webpage? (2006). As recently as 2015, when a wave of ventures arose in China, this book was still recommended as a must-read for budding entrepreneurs. It was seen as a principle that platform builders should ensure users had nothing to worry about and could simply rely on it.

While Pandora unintentionally opened her box, we intentionally opened ours.

Internet giants formed network effects via massive user data, and gained a monopoly over our cyber lives. Their products appeared to be free, yet they are nonetheless expensive in terms of data exploitation, as â€œusers are the real products - products to be sold to advertisersâ€. Using data, platforms can deliver more targeted ads to individuals and even influence their thinking. The relationship between user, platform and advertiser is the â€œtriangular tradeâ€ of our time.

More importantly, creators who contribute the bulk of content on the Internet are almost never compensated fairly for their efforts. They produce a lot yet get very little in return. The needs of platforms, advertisers and product managers always take precedence over those of creators. Itâ€™s not uncommon for the platforms to demand creators to grant them perpetual licensing to their work. Aaron Hillel Swartz (1986-2013), the inventor of RSS and Markdown, even paid the ultimate price for recovering the rights of creators.

Therefore, Web 2.0â€™s demise is just like that of Web 1.0. Platforms do help users engage more freely, but they also steal more than what they give. Early adopters of the Internet are like Prometheus snatching fire from the earthâ€™s fire source; however, platforms suspend Prometheusâ€™ account, claiming he has violated the user agreement.

Who is the rightful owner of user data? What is the best way to distribute the profits? Does it make sense to have too-big-to-fail platforms?

These are some of the most fundamental questions to be addressed in todayâ€™s Internet. The most typical responses to such inquiries are that technology is a double-edged sword, and that its effectiveness depends on how we utilize it. Both sound like misrepresentations to me, because people who complain about the flavor of their apple pie shouldnâ€™t be intuitively blamed for eating it incorrectly. Although the Internet is wonderful, we have to recognize that not all progress treats users fairly.

If you are also concerned about these challenges, now itâ€™s the time to talk about the so-called â€œWeb3â€.

**Web3: The New Narrative**

New concepts are always full of exciting possibilities, and Web3 is no exception to this rule. Despite its presumably complex nature, Web3 just pivots around the relationship between data, ownership, and users.

Who should own user data and the value that users have created? What is the best way to define the legitimacy of the ownership? If users should control their own data, who owns the platform data? How should the platform be run if it belongs to everyone? Which currency should be used for revenue settlement?

These are the questions that Web3 is trying to answer.

Web3 aims to better connect consumers with their data, content and monetization opportunities via blockchain. Users must give their permissions first, before a platform accesses their data. Users can also claim ownership of the platform. Users, employees and investors then become not only unique â€œshareholdersâ€ but also distinct identities of the same person. Since users own their data, it will be much easier for them to migrate from one platform to another, and so will decentralization. Meanwhile, crypto, as the best-known blockchain application, ties all of this to monetization.

Critics can argue that not all of Web3â€™s solutions are perfect, but they canâ€™t deny the gravity of the challenge that Web3 is trying to address.

However, no societal issues raised by one technology can be resolved by another. Inertia is a human trait. New technology should show its differentiations, before gaining trust from users. Web3 isnâ€™t just about technological innovation, itâ€™s also renovating the narrative of the Web.Â  Perhaps even some of the Web3â€™s evangelists havenâ€™t realized that what they advocate is never the tech, but its legitimacy. Technology canâ€™t endorse itself, it has to be endorsed. It's about the "dominant discourse" per se\[1\].

The world weâ€™re living in is built on Web 2.0 and moulded by the narrative of Web 2.0. If you are an entrepreneur, you would probably believe in â€œthe lean startup principlesâ€ and â€œfast iterationâ€ to generate â€œthe network effectâ€ and build a â€œplatformâ€. Also, you may agree that â€œmeasuring data means improving dataâ€, â€œeveryone should think like a product managerâ€, â€œdata is the new oilâ€, and â€œrecommender systems benefit content distributionâ€.

All of this is what we call the â€œInternet thinkingâ€ in Mandarin. It wasnâ€™t invented by Web 2.0, but was carried forward by Web 2.0 and its epoch. It became the Internet Gospel, or the axiom in the Internet world. Iâ€™m not criticizing it, but it is indeed something that canâ€™t be questioned or altered.

Entrepreneurs never say to investors that they donâ€™t want the â€œnetwork effectâ€; developers never refuse â€œfast iterationâ€; nobody ever questions the value of data. This narrative is the â€œmental sealâ€\[2\] by the Internet.

Until this narrative, flourished by Web 2.0, started to crack off. Web3 is like the black ships in the Perry Expedition, making Web 2.0â€™s ports open. It also makes everyone who has become accustomed to the Web 2.0 narrative question whether their habits are correct - all habits must be â€œcorrectedâ€ in this process.

Is the network effect the fate of the Internet?

Does the Internet have to choose from the only two exits - becoming a platform or joining a platform?

Do users only have the right of use, not the right of ownership?

Though more data is always better, is it better for the platforms or the users?

When the Web 2.0 narrative started to break down, new ideas about the Internet began to emerge. By pivoting concepts that we are accustomed to, we can revive our creativity towards the Internet. The Web3 narrative is revolutionizing the Web 2.0â€™s. Even using â€œWeb 3â€ instead of â€œWeb 3.0â€ is part of the narrative - Web3 isnâ€™t the upgraded Web 2.0, but rather, it should be something new.

Web3 isnâ€™t just about technology; itâ€™s a big thing that extends to sophisticated technologies and exhilarating ideas. Should we first talk about distributed storage, NFT, and decentralization, or how to build a better Internet? We have two paths to cover - technological and ideological. The ideological is different from the technological, since itâ€™s inspired by technology, but it always shows a considerable â€œlead timeâ€. Often, itâ€™s only when a problem with technology has occurred that we begin to think about the real problems that we aim to resolve. At the same time, among all the technological problems, which one to be prioritized is an ideological problem. Technological advances lead to ideological shifts, and ideological shifts further technological advances - this is a social cycle with many examples in history.


---

Part 2:

[https://firelily.mirror.xyz/uMGkgcoTrthx-6YSIht_uGLk8E3phGrIOuQOtKJOFpI](https://firelily.mirror.xyz/uMGkgcoTrthx-6YSIht_uGLk8E3phGrIOuQOtKJOFpI)

\[1\]: Dominant discourse refers to the most prevalent concepts or expressions when we think of the Internet, for instance, "data is the king", "big platforms", "recommender systems", etc.

\[2\]: The "mental seal" is from the Three-Body Problem, the Hugo-Award-winning sci-fi novel by the Chinese writer Liu Cixin. If people are mental-sealed, they will never change their perspectives on certain things. Some can be mental-sealed to an extreme, so much so that they can't even realize the existence of the mental seal.

This is the first part of this article, in the next part I will discuss the relationship between technological progress and ideas, as well as some criticisms of web 3.

Thanks to NK, exuberantLiu, and Mohan Wang for helping me to translate. Thanks to Mohan Wang for editing.
